embeds.title: Darkling
embeds.description:
Normal / 48-56 (50-59) HP / Slay the Spire

**:intent_a: Nip**
```ansi
[2;31mD [2;34m(D+2).
```**:intent_a: Chomp**
```ansi
[2;31m8x2 [2;34m(9x2).
```**:intent_b: Harden**
```ansi
[2;31m12. [2;34m(Gains [0;2m2 [2;33mStrength).
```**:intent_u: Regrow**
```ansi
[0;2mNothing.
```**:intent_f: Reincarnate**
```ansi
[0;2mRevives with 50% HP.
```
D is a random number chosen between 7 and 11 for each darkling that does not change.
Middle Darkling: 50%/50% chance to use Nip/Harden.
Side Darklings: Same pattern as the middle Darkling on turn 1, then has a 30%/40%/30% chance to use Nip/Chomp/Harden.
Cannot use Harden or Chomp twice in a row, or Nip three times in a row.
When killed, if there are other Darklings alive, uses Regrow then Reincarnate.
Despite not being a "minion" enemy, **Fatal** effects used on Darklings will not trigger unless there are no other darklings alive.

Waste Not is the "we have Just Desserts at home" card. Costing 2 instead of 1 is really bad since it locks you out of playing it multiple times in a turn. As many people have already pointed out, "all" is often worse than 2 or 3, by a lot, since it stuffs basic, non card drawing Licks back in. 

You can sometimes take this as a desperation move to save a thin Growth Punch and Lick+ deck that you forced but just never found a Just Desserts. Even in that slot, though, Recycling does a better job. 

Overall, kind of a noob trap. But, the cards can't all be top power tier. Maybe that's OK?

alright I am home, it is time. This card is a massive trap. Imo it should just be 2(1) cost no exhaust. It's called waste not, but it makes you waste so much draw on drawing basic licks if you use it late into the fight, and if you use it early you may not have exhausted all your real licks. This is in a really awkward spot where it is lick synergy that anti-synergizes with lick synergy. Anything that gives you basic licks makes this card fall off hard.
And also, it is rare to have that many licks, since licks are all around pretty damn bad unupgraded, and I don't feel like visiting 10 campfires per act to upgrade licks.

There are 3 cards that exhume a single lick, and one that exhumes two. Then there is this that exhumes a potentially limitless amount. That means that you need a lot of licks to make it more valuable than the cheaper options at exhuming (needs to exhume 4 licks to match the energy to exhume ratio that just desserts has, and that doesn't include the like 16 aoe damage you'd deal) and at some point you realize that you don't really need to do that.
Hence why I said this is just the <toxic egg> card

embeds.title: Toxic Egg
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Whenever you add a Skill into your deck, **Upgrade** it.
*"What a marvelous discovery! This appears to be the inert egg of some magical creature. Who or what created this?" - Ranwid*

messages.content: I think that licks have an overall flawed design (their upgrade makes them infinitely better) and this card falls victim to that fact

It's a pretty awkward card. You need to be in a really specific spot for it to be good, and it can easily end up being actively bad if you have too many generators of basic licks, or several unupgraded licks. If you have 4-6 upgraded licks and no basic licks, it can be pretty powerful, but that is a very odd spot to find yourself in. It also has a lot of competition from just desserts and recycling, which are cheaper cards that don't have the same potential issues in deckbuilding. Slime boss is also generally incentivized to take some of the better basic lick generators, and to only have 1-2 of the better upgraded licks so that they can recur their effects, which makes it hard to find a good spot for waste not. 

One place where this card can be good is to create additional frontloading for slime boss. If you draw it in the bottom half of your deck, you can use it to quickly apply a ton of goop to enemies and try to finish them off with burst damage. The basic licks clogging up your discard pile doesn't matter if the fight is over before you reshuffle, and if you have ways to make each individual lick apply more goop (spreading slime), or ways to not consume the goop (douse in slime) then you can amplify the effect of spamming several licks and end fights quickly. I still wouldn't call that a particularly good strategy, and if you draw waste not too early it doesn't work at all, but it is one option. Having 4 energy makes this card much better, since you want to empty your hand as much as possible before casting it, ink bottle and letter opener can both make spamming several cheap licks better. The upgrade is odd, it doesn't really fit well with the bursty nature of the card, and if you are filling your discard pile with basic licks, then it's going to be a long time before you redraw waste not. I suppose it's a decent upgrade if you have 4-6 good upgraded licks you want to spam as often as possible, but again, that's a very specific and difficult spot to get to.
